name: Apocalypse: The Game
detailed_description:
Disclaimer


I'll be using this to clear some common confusions. Firstly, this isn't an AAA experience, this is an Early Access experience, if you're looking for an already finished title, take a look into DayZ or H1Z1. Secondly, we're a completely singleplayer title, and that's the final direction, if you're after an pvp multiplayer experience, so again, your in the wrong place. Thanks!


Campaign


Our campaign is being written and being implemented into the game. With huge amounts of content being added once it's finished, including more building mechanics, more vehicles, and with voiced characters! Consider joining the discord to follow everything at https://discord.gg/Vk43Fzu!


Support


We've finished the Windows, Mac, Linux, and SteamOS support! With every update being released to all these platforms at the same time. After purchasing one platform on Steam, all the other platforms will also added to your account free of charge. We're also supporting Vulken and Directx 12.


Greenlight

After three years of development, we're glad to announce that we're on Steam! To our supporters, thanks for staying with us and keeping track of the development progress through our website and Twitter, we appreciate all of the feedback and we look forward to the final Steam release. If you have already downloaded the apocalypse through our website, then feel free to contact us and we'll let you continue playing on steam free of charge.


Workshop

We now support the steam workshop for playing on community maps, community modes and more! We'll have an official guide on modding soon available here and on our website. Go to the community section and head to guides. This will be available to the public.


Controller

We've now got full controller support Thanks to this, we now support all Xbox 360, Xbox One, Xbox Elite, DualShock 4 and DualShock 3 controllers in-game! This was added in the 0.1.1.4.b update. Check out the patch notes for more details.


About the Game

Apocalypse is the upcoming survival built entirely by one developer, with a growing community, the apocalypse focuses on singleplayer apocalyptic survival, with all of the latest graphics technologies integrated together such as Physx 3, Unity 2017.3, Directx 12, and Vulkan API. Built and funded by the community! The final release will feature a fully voiced campaign which follows the life of a survivor, struggling to fight alongside the few established factions left, in one immersive first person shooter experience. With Windows, Linux, SteamOS, and Mac now supported while we're in development!



We're very different from typical development projects, because this is a solo project, meaning we're completely open to ideas, improvements, and implementations! After playing you can head to our community page, our twitter page, or our website and give us feedback, submit any bugs, and suggest more features that you'd like to see in a future update. Many of the apocalypse's features have been integrated thanks to the community's feedback, such as the building system, vulken support, and the factions within the campaign. Furthermore the idea of Linux, SteamOS, and Mac support was introduced by the community!



Since the start of the apocalypse's development, we've spent months working on our unique maps in survival and sandbox modes. All of the environments have been hand-crafted with realistic props and buildings with constant updates to the visuals and shaders to polish the overall appearance. Built so that you can scavenge items, craft shelter and build structures. In the future we're updating the title to have the much requested looting system too.



The sandbox mode is a open-ended mode for the player to build shelters, defenses, towns, etc, while exploring the map, taking advantage of the steam workshop support. Along with the survival mode, with the same amount of maps, but much faster paced with mutants to fight across various waves. These will be added to while we're in early access, such as more building items, more mutants, more maps, etc! Finally there's the in-construction story mode, which will be where you'll get the most gameplay after the final release, completely singleplayer based!



Some information about us, we're a small development group, with only one developer and one publisher, we design, publish and sell indie games. Previously we've made three game titles, two of which are in development. We've been running since January 2014 and all of our team are dedicated to making high quality products on different platforms and marketplaces, we started with several game ideas and have evolved since since then with more then two thousand community members and more then 500 early access downloads. We're glad to finally make a Steam release and we plan to keep supporting the apocalypse. Here's a quick mention to everyone who deserves credit from what we've achieved so far:

  • Harley Dolton (Our Developer)
  • Albertino Robelló (Marketing)
  • David Lee (Our Writer)
  • Unity Technologies (Game Engine)
  • Opsive Industries (Assets)
  • Microsoft (DirectX API)
  • Khronos (Vulkan API)
  • Apple and Linus Torvalds (Additional Support)

short_description: Apocalypse is a survival title built by one developer, with more then £16k earnings and hundreds of community members helping shape the direction of the project. Along with a sandbox, survival and campaign mode being constantly improved and added to. Now updated with 5 supported platforms!
reviews:
“Solo Project Apocalypse: The Game Storms Toward Release”
Gameranx

“Apocalypse: The Game Survival Game Enters Early Access”
One Angry Gamer

“Apocalypse: The Game is the Latest Zombie Survival First-Person Shooter”
Sanvada

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows XP SP2+
  • Processor: AMD FX 6350
  • Memory: 6 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Radeon HD 6850
  • DirectX: Version 9.0
  • Storage: 4 GB available space
  • Sound Card: Mono or Stereo
  • Additional Notes: 32 Bit and 64 Bit Supported
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: AMD Ryzen 5 1600x
  • Memory: 12 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Geforce GTX 970
  • DirectX: Version 12
  • Storage: 4 GB available space
  • Sound Card: Mono or Stereo
  • Additional Notes: Vulkan API Supported

mac_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Mac OS X 10.9+
  • Processor: SSE2 Supported CPU
  • Memory: 6 GB RAM
  • Graphics: DX9, or DX11 GPU
  • Storage: 6 GB available space
  • Sound Card: Mono or Stereo
  • Additional Notes: 32 Bit and 64 Bit Supported
mac_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Mac OS X 10.13
  • Processor: SSE2 Supported CPU
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: DX9, or DX11 GPU
  • Storage: 6 GB available space
  • Sound Card: Mono or Stereo
  • Additional Notes: 32 Bit and 64 Bit Supported

linux_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Ubuntu 12.04+
  • Processor: SSE2 Supported CPU
  • Memory: 6 GB RAM
  • Graphics: DX9, or DX11 GPU
  • Storage: 4 GB available space
  • Sound Card: Mono or Stereo
  • Additional Notes: 32 Bit and 64 Bit Supported
linux_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Ubuntu 17.10
  • Processor: SSE2 Supported CPU
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: DX9, or DX11 GPU
  • Storage: 4 GB available space
  • Sound Card: Mono or Stereo
  • Additional Notes: 32 Bit and 64 Bit Supported
